item.title: Shakib's bowling suspension by ECB extends to international cricket, confirms BCB - Cricbuzz
item.description:
Shakib's Bowling Suspension by ECB Extends to International Cricket, Confirms BCB

Published on: Sun, Dec 15, 2024, 05:16 PM | Source: Cricbuzz

Shakib Al Hasan faces a new setback as the Bangladesh Cricket Board announced that his suspension from bowling in ECB competitions now applies to all domestic and international cricket.

  • Shakib's suspension was confirmed by the BCB following his reported bowling action in a match for Surrey.
  • The ICC automatically recognizes and enforces suspensions by national cricket federations.
  • This is the first scrutiny of Shakib's bowling action in his 17-year career, having taken 712 international wickets.
  • Shakib had announced his retirement from T20Is and has expressed intentions to quit ODIs after the Champions Trophy.
  • He remains eligible to play purely as a batsman and will seek reassessment of his bowling action at an accredited center.
‚ÄúWhen a National Cricket Federation suspends a player from bowling in its domestic cricket competitions, the suspension is automatically recognised and enforced by the ICC.‚Äù

Shakib‚Äôs future in cricket may hinge on the outcome of his reassessment and the reinstatement of his bowling privileges.

item.title: "Rightly Went Unsold": Prithvi Shaw Once Again Under Fire After Disappointing Show - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Rightly Went Unsold: Prithvi Shaw Once Again Under Fire After Disappointing Show

Publication Date: December 15, 2024

Source: NDTV Sports

Prithvi Shaw faced heavy criticism after a disappointing performance in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy final, contributing to growing concerns regarding his form and fitness as he went unsold in the IPL 2025 auction.

  • Prithvi Shaw scored only 10 runs off 6 balls in the final against Madhya Pradesh.
  • Mumbai secured the SMAT title, defeating Madhya Pradesh by five wickets.
  • Shaw's poor performance followed a year without significant scores, raising doubts about his future.
  • Suryakumar Yadav's performance (48 runs) helped stabilize the innings for Mumbai.
"Prithvi Shaw rightly went unsold at the auction. No fitness. No fielding. No discipline. Cameos at best with the bat." ‚Äî Vipul Ghatol üáÆüá≥ (@Vipul_Espeaks)

The match highlighted Shaw's struggles while showcasing Mumbai's strength in depth, leading to speculation about his professional future and fitness.

item.title: Mumbai vs Madhya Pradesh Highlights, SMAT 2024 Final: Shedge wins it for MUM as they claim second title - The Indian Express
item.description:
Mumbai vs Madhya Pradesh Highlights, SMAT 2024 Final: Shedge wins it for MUM as they claim second title

Date: December 14, 2024 Source: Indian Express

Mumbai's star-studded batting lineup successfully chased down a target of 175 runs set by Madhya Pradesh, winning the SMAT 2024 final.

  • Rajat Patidar scored an unbeaten 81 runs for Madhya Pradesh, helping them post a competitive total.
  • Mumbai, opting to field first, restricted MP to 175 runs in 20 overs.
  • Suryansh Shedge played a pivotal role by scoring a quick 36 runs off just 15 balls, leading Mumbai to victory in 18 overs.
  • Suryakumar Yadav contributed 48 runs, maintaining control over the innings.
  • This match marked Mumbai's second title in the tournament‚Äôs history.
‚ÄúDespite batting at No 3 for RCB in the past, Rajat Patidar has been batting at No 5 for Madhya Pradesh.‚Äù

This thrilling final showcased Mumbai‚Äôs dominance in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy, further solidifying their status in Indian cricket.

item.title: Life-changing day: Dharavi‚Äôs Simran Shaikh, daughter of a wireman, fetches Rs 1.90 crore bid at WPL auction - The Indian Express
item.description:
Dharavi's Simran Shaikh Achieves Historic Bid at WPL Auction

Date: December 15, 2024 | Source: The Indian Express

Simran Shaikh, a resident of Dharavi, was sold for Rs 1.90 crore to Gujarat Giants at the Women's Premier League auction, showcasing her incredible journey from facing discouragement to achieving success.

  • Simran was initially discouraged from playing cricket due to societal expectations.
  • She is now the second-highest paid uncapped player after Kashvee Gautam.
  • Simran plans to use her earnings to improve her family's living situation.
  • Multiple uncapped Indian players received significant bids during the auction.
‚ÄúI have no words to express my joy... Today the same people have come to congratulate our family.‚Äù ‚Äì Simran Shaikh

Simran's success at the auction not only uplifts her family but also serves as an inspiration for aspiring athletes from underprivileged backgrounds.

item.title: Morne Morkel reveals one area where Indian bowlers need to get better at - The Times of India
item.description:
Morne Morkel reveals one area where Indian bowlers need to get better at

Date: NEW DELHI Source: Times of India

Morne Morkel, India‚Äôs bowling coach, emphasized the need for improvement among Indian bowlers, particularly during the overs 50 to 80 against Australian batter Travis Head.

  • Morkel noted that the Indian bowlers struggled to execute their strategies effectively.
  • He highlighted the impact of the partnership between Travis Head and Steve Smith, which scored 171 runs in 31 overs.
  • Morkel indicated the need to improve execution during crucial phases of the match with a softer ball.
  • He defended the performance of other bowlers like Mohammed Siraj and Akash Deep, commending their efforts despite challenges.
  • Morkel backed Ravindra Jadeja, emphasizing his status as a world-class player despite a tough outing.
‚ÄúFirst of all, we can say he's (Head) in pretty good form... but I think for us with the ball... that's one area I think we need to get better at.‚Äù - Morne Morkel

The Indian bowling team is looking to enhance their game strategy to perform better in upcoming sessions, aiming to contain the scoring rate efficiently.

item.title: "Bowled Really Nicely": Steve Smith's Big Praise For Star India Pacer. It's Not Jasprit Bumrah - NDTV Sports
item.description:
"Bowled Really Nicely": Steve Smith's Big Praise For Star India Pacer. It's Not Jasprit Bumrah

Publication Date: December 24, 2024

Source: NDTV

In a commendable performance during the third Test match, Indian pacer Akash Deep caught the attention of Australia‚Äôs Steve Smith, who noted Deep's remarkable bowling skills despite not taking any wickets.

  • Akash Deep received high praise from Steve Smith for his impressive bowling on the second day of the third Test.
  • Smith scored his 33rd Test hundred, contributing to Australia's strong position with 405 for seven at stumps, while facing tough spells from Jasprit Bumrah and Akash Deep.
  • Smith described Deep's first spell as having significant movement and excellent length, showcasing his skills as a bowler.
  • Travis Head also made a notable contribution with 152 runs from 160 balls, impressing both Smith and spectators.
  • Smith referenced past performance struggles against India, calling the series opener in Perth an anomaly.
"I thought Akash bowled really nicely. He has got some skill there for sure." - Steve Smith

This match highlights both the skill of Akash Deep and the competitive nature of the ongoing series, providing an exciting display of cricket.

item.title: Gukesh Wins 2024 FIDE World Championship ‚Äî 13 Conclusions - Chess.com
item.description:
Gukesh Wins 2024 FIDE World Championship ‚Äî 13 Conclusions

Date: December 13, 2024

Source: Chess.com

The era of India's GM Gukesh Dommaraju as chess world champion has begun after an incredibly hard-fought 2024 FIDE World Championship in Singapore, which ended dramatically when the reigning champion GM Ding Liren blundered in the final classical game.

  • Gukesh becomes the 18th World Chess Champion at just 18 years old.
  • His victory fulfills a childhood dream of bringing the title back to India.
  • The championship match was highly competitive, not a blowout as some feared.
  • The ending of the match was anticlimactic but spectacular.
  • Gukesh's resilience helped him navigate through the challenges.
  • Ding's performance surprised many after a tough year.
  • Gukesh's mental preparation was crucial in this match.
  • Gukesh's self-belief and support from his team proved vital.
  • Ding's inability to capitalize on advantages hindered his success.
  • Gukesh's achievement is seen as beneficial for chess as a whole.

‚ÄúWhen Magnus won, I thought I really want to be the one to bring back the title to India.‚Äù ‚Äî Gukesh Dommaraju

This championship marks a significant milestone in Gukesh's career and Indian chess history, inspiring future generations of players.

item.description:
WPL Auction Highlights: Gujarat break the bank for Simran, Dottin; Sneh Rana goes unsold

Date: Dec 15, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The WPL Auction in Bengaluru witnessed Gujarat Giants purchase Simran Shaikh for ‚Çπ1.9 Crores and Deandra Dottin for ‚Çπ1.7 Crores, amidst numerous players going unsold, including veteran Sneh Rana.

  • Key player acquisitions included:
    • Gujarat Giants: Simran Shaikh (‚Çπ1.9 Cr), Deandra Dottin (‚Çπ1.7 Cr)
    • Mumbai Indians: Kamalini (‚Çπ1.6 Cr)
    • Royal Challengers Bengaluru: Prema Rawat (‚Çπ1.2 Cr)
  • A total of 120 players were set to go under the hammer.
  • Surprising unsold players included Sneh Rana and Heather Knight.
‚ÄúSimran is the most expensive buy in this auction with Gujarat spending 1.9 Cr on her.‚Äù

The auction showcased intense bidding wars, particularly for top players, while underlining the challenges for franchises to balance spending and talent acquisition.

item.title: Fox Sports commentator Isa Guha allegedly makes racially-sensitive remark about Jasprit Bumrah on air - The Indian Express
item.description:
Border Gavaskar Trophy: Fox Sports commentator Isa Guha allegedly makes racially-sensitive remark about Jasprit Bumrah on air

Publication Date: December 15, 2024 | Source: Indian Express

Fox Sports commentator Isa Guha has sparked controversy after allegedly making a racially-sensitive comment about Indian cricketer Jasprit Bumrah during a live broadcast.

  • The incident occurred during Day 2 of the third Test between India and Australia at the Gabba.
  • Isa Guha referred to Bumrah as the "Most Valuable Primate" in a commentary, which raised eyebrows given the historical context of racial tensions in cricket.
  • The comment drew comparisons to the 2008 Monkeygate scandal involving Harbhajan Singh and Andrew Symonds.
  • Social media users reacted strongly, referring to Guha's remark as a second coming of Monkeygate.
‚ÄúHe‚Äôs the MVP, isn't he? Most valuable primate, Jasprit Bumrah.‚Äù - Isa Guha

This incident highlights the ongoing sensitivity surrounding racial language in sports commentary, particularly in the context of cricket's past controversies.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah Faces 'Racial Slur' On Commentary; Fans Reminded Of 'Monkeygate' Scandal - NDTV Sports

item.title: 'Bumrah did most things right, but others...': Ravi Shastri slams India bowlers for 'make it hard' for Rohit Sharma - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Ravi Shastri Critiques India's Bowling Performance Against Australia

Date: Dec 15, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Ravi Shastri has voiced concerns regarding the inconsistency of India's bowling attack during the ongoing third Test against Australia at the Gabba, highlighting Jasprit Bumrah's individual brilliance amidst overall underperformance.

  • Jasprit Bumrah took 5 wickets for 72 runs but was the only effective bowler.
  • Australia set a strong total of 405/7, with Travis Head and Steve Smith each scoring centuries.
  • Shastri criticized the lack of discipline among other bowlers, stressing the need for a consistent strategy.
  • Bumrah leads the series with 17 wickets, significantly ahead of the next best Indian bowler, Siraj with 10 wickets.
‚ÄúThey were giving away runs on both sides.‚Äù ‚Äì Ravi Shastri

In conclusion, Shastri's insights suggest that maintaining discipline and consistency in the bowling unit is crucial for India to compete effectively in the crucial Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

item.title: "Get Out Of My Space": Australia Great Slams Mohammed Siraj-Marnus Labuschagne Bail-Switching Drama - NDTV Sports
item.description:
"Get Out Of My Space": Australia Great Slams Mohammed Siraj-Marnus Labuschagne Bail-Switching Drama

Publication Date: December 15, 2024

Source: NDTV

One of the highlights of Day 2 of the third Test between India and Australia was the 'bail-switching' moment between Indian pacer Mohammed Siraj and Australian batter Marnus Labuschagne. Siraj's superstition led him to switch the bails, only for Labuschagne to switch them back before being dismissed shortly after.

  • The incident occurred during a crucial moment in the match.
  • Labuschagne was dismissed for 12 runs and criticized by Matthew Hayden for being distracted.
  • Travis Head, who replaced Labuschagne, scored a century and formed a strong partnership with Steve Smith.
  • Head now has over 1,200 runs against India in international cricket since 2023.
"He saw 55 deliveries, and had no go forward whatsoever. Even that little exchange, if it was me at the crease and a bowler does that. I am not caring less." - Matthew Hayden

Labuschagne's dismissal was a turning point, paving the way for a strong performance from Travis Head and Steve Smith, putting Australia in a dominant position.
